column2: Laurelwood Elementary School\r4280 Partridge Drive • San Jose
column4: Principal\rkgreen@eesd.org\rhttp://laurelwood.eesd.org/\r\r----2018-19 School Accountability Report Card\r----\rPublished During the 2019-20 School Year\r\rCommunity & School Profile\rEvergreen School District
column5: located in the City of San Jose
column6: is comprised of fifteen elementary schools\rand three middle schools. Once a small farming city
column7: San Jose became a magnet for suburban\rnewcomers between the 1960s and the 1990s
column8: and is now the third largest city in California. The\rcity is located in Silicon Valley
column9: at the southern end of the San Francisco Bay Area
column12: 908 residents.\r\rLaurelwood Elementary School is centrally located within the district’s borders. Built in 1971
column13: \r--------\rLaurelwood serves to approximately 300 students from kinder to sixth grade. Additionally
column14: our site\rEvergreen School District\rhouses four County special needs classes. Our demographic population is comprised of Asian (46%)
column17: African-American (5%) and Two or more races (12%) students. To add
column19: 95148\r23% of our students are English Language Learners
column21: and 13%of our students have disabilities. In the 2018-2019 schoolyear
column22: we\rwww.eesd.org\rachieved an overall 59% proficiency on English-Language Arts and 63% on Mathematics CAASPP\rDistrict Governing Board\rtesting.The school provides a family-oriented
column24: and safe place for students to learn
column29: and administrators continue to act on the principle that\r\rstudents come first.\rJim Zito
column30: President Pro-Tem\r\r\rDiscipline & Climate for Learning\rChristopher Corpus
column31: ClerkStudents at Laurelwood Elementary are guided by specific rules and classroom expectations that\r\rpromoterespect
column34: Trusteediscipline program is to provide students with opportunities to learn self-discipline through a\r\rsystem of consistent rewards and consequences for their behavior.  Our school implements PBIS\rMarisa Hanson
column35: Trustee(Positive Behavioral Interventions and Supports). Additionally
column36: we have also built in a monthly Lion\rCharacter Building Program to support students' social and emotional learning with Habits of Mind\r\rto promote District AdministrationandProjectCornerstoneAssets.ThepartnershipwithProjectCornerstonehelps\rresearch-baseddevelopmentalassetsasaguidingframeworkforthesupportandhealthy\rDr. Emy Flores\rdevelopment of all children.\rSuperintendent\r\rDan Deguara\rParents and students are informed of school rules and discipline policies at the beginning of the\rAssistant Superintendent
column37: \rschool year through the Parent-Student Handbook. Ongoing school-to-home communication is Educational Services\rfacilitatedthroughBack-to-SchoolNight
column40: weekly\rCesar Torrico\rnewsletters & texts and the school website.\rAssistant Superintendent
column41: Human\rResources\rSchool Vision Statement\rDelores Perley\rChief Business OfficerLaurelwood will inspire students to pursue their aspirations
column43: and dreams for the future in a\rsafe and supportive environment.\rKim Kianidehkian\rDirector
column44: Educational Services\rSchool Mission Statement\rRick Navarro\rLaurelwood is committed to engaging minds and celebrating creativity. We prepare our students\rDirector
column50: caring environment to educate the whole child. As\rDirector
column52: we inspire our students to become well--rounded
column54: prepared to be\rTonya Trim\rfuture leaders. A partnership of families
column56: and community working together. Agents of change.\rDirector
